contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Officeholder |name = Abdul Qadir Bajamal |image = |office = [[Prime Minister of Yemen]] |president = [[Ali Abdullah Saleh]] |term_start = 31 March 2001 |term_end = 7 April 2007 |predecessor = [[Abd Al-Karim Al-Iryani]] |successor = [[Ali Muhammad Mujawar]] |birth_date = {{birth year and age|1946|2|18}} |birth_place = [[San'a]], [[North Yemen]] <small>(now [[Yemen]])</small> |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[General People's Congress (Yemen)|General People's Congress]] |religion = [[Islam]] }} '''Abdul Qadir Bajamal''' ({{lang-ar|عبد القادر باجمال}}) (born February 18, 1946) was the [[Prime Minister of Yemen|Prime Minister]] of [[Yemen]] from 31 March 2001 until 7 April 2007.<ref name=yemen>{{cite web| url = http://rulers.org/rulyz.html | title = Yemen | accessdate = 2011-01-01 | publisher = ''rulers.org''| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20101218113944/http://rulers.org/rulyz.html| archivedate= 18 December 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> He is a member of the [[General People's Congress (Yemen)|General People's Congress]] party and had been appointed by [[President of Yemen|President]] [[Ali Abdullah Saleh]]. Before Bajamal's appointment as Prime Minister, he had served as Foreign Minister from 1998 to 2001. ==References== {{reflist}} {{start box}} {{s-off}} {{succession box|title=[[Prime Minister of Yemen]]|before=[[Abdul Karim al-Iryani]]|after=[[Ali Mohammed Mujur]]|years=2001–2007}} {{end box}} {{YemenPMs}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Bajamal | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = February 18, 1946 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[San'a]], [[North Yemen]] (now [[Yemen]]) | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = I FATHER OF = Sohail Abdul Qader Bajamal }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bajamal}} [[Category:1946 births]] [[Category:Arab politicians]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Yemen]] [[Category:General People's Congress (Yemen) politicians]] [[Category:Government ministers of Yemen]] [[Category:People from Sana'a]] {{Yemen-politician-stub}}
